description:
Chef Fawzi Kotb brings a sophisticated depth of knowledge to Velouté Bistro @ Palace Pier. Velouté is a contemporary and chic bistro that promotes the terroir farm-to-table slow food movement using locally sourced ingredients and unique food preparation methods which inspire and challenge the most discerning palette. 
Veloute has won several awards including Canadian Choice Award for Fine Dining (2025) in Etobicoke, the DiRona Award 2025 and 2026 for its refined French cuisine and intimate dining experience, and the Tripadvisor's Travellers' Choice Award for its excellent reviews and service. 
Complimentary parking available.

description: A favourite North Toronto neighbourhood restaurant, The Monkey Bar offers a contemporary bistro menu designed and prepared by proprietor and Chef Richard Fox-Revett. Everything is prepared in-house, from sourdough bread, seafood, meat, and pasta dishes, and even the hand-cranked ice cream, using local, sustainable and organic ingredients whenever possible. The extensive wine list features new and old world wines by the glass, half litre and bottle. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the service is knowledgeable and friendly.

description: Led by Chef Eric Chong, R&D is a bold and modern restaurant in the heart of Toronto’s iconic Chinatown. Awarded by Michelin 2024 as the best Indian restaurant for an exceptional dining experience.

description: Bar Bacan is a female-led, LGBTQ+ friendly family-run restaurant that strives to have each and every guest feel welcome in their “home”. Bacan's goal is to nourish hearts and stomachs with everlasting memories. Everything on Bacan's menu is made from scratch and is designed to bring out authentic Argentinian and Venezuelan flavours using local ingredients. Gluten-free, vegetarian and vegan options are available.

appetizers.description: A warm, colourful start to winter — roasted local squash, heirloom carrots, and golden beets tossed in a thyme-honey vinaigrette and finished with creamy stracciatella, the fresh cheese found inside burrata; the mix of sweet, earthy vegetables, candied pecans, and Grana Padano makes this the perfect balance of comfort and elegance
appetizers.name: Warm Root Mosaic & Stracciatella

appetizers.description: Mini pork roll-ups from Puglia — thin slices of pork shoulder stuffed with pecorino, wrapped in guanciale, and glazed with a balsamic-fig reduction, served over a smooth rapini pesto for that perfect sweet, salty, and earthy bite
appetizers.name: Bombette di Maiale al Guanciale e Fichi

appetizers.description: Mini meatballs made with local grass-fed beef and a molten mozzarella center, simmered in Mama’s sugo and finished with shaved ricotta salata; small, saucy, and full of love — just how Nonna would’ve done it
appetizers.name: Piccole Polpette al Cuore di Mozzarella

appetizers.description: Hearty winter vegetable soup made with local squash, carrots, beans, and greens — slow-simmered in a rich tomato broth and served with a toasted crostini topped with roasted red peppers marinated in garlic, parsley, and olive oil; simple, soulful, and vegan by nature
appetizers.name: Minestrone d’Inverno

Dinner.appetizers_notes:
At 7 Numbers, the Winterlicious appetizers celebrate the honest, soulful cooking of southern Italy — simple dishes done with care, local ingredients, and a few old family secrets. Each plate is designed to open the meal the way Nonna Rosa always did: with warmth, generosity, and bold flavour.
Guests can expect rich, seasonal ingredients like roasted winter vegetables, slow-cooked sauces, and all prepared in-house. The menu draws on the traditions of Puglia and Bari — where the family roots run deep — blending rustic comfort with the energy of modern Toronto dining.
Known for hearty portions, scratch cooking, and that signature 7 Numbers welcome — your Winterlicious meal will start exactly the way an Italian meal should: with love, wine on the table, and something that makes you say “mamma mia, that’s good.”

desserts.description: Creamy cheesecake layered with tart sour-cherry compote, served in a 125ml mason jar; rich, bright, and made in-house the old-school way
desserts.name: Sour Cherry Cheesecake

desserts.description: A layered mousse of white and dark chocolate, whipped light and silky, presented in a 125ml mason jar; simple, elegant, and dangerously smooth

desserts.description: Espresso-soaked ladyfingers, mascarpone, and a swirl of Nutella, all packed into a 125ml mason jar; a playful, chocolate-forward twist on the classic
desserts.name: Nutella Tiramisu

main_dishes.description: Slow-braised Ontario short ribs in red wine and San Marzano tomato, tossed with locally made paccheri from Grano D’uro — crafted with GMO-free semolina from Altamura and Conestoga farm eggs, finished with  gremolata, and shaved Grana Padano
main_dishes.name: Paccheri al Brasato di Manzo e Vino Rosso

main_dishes.description: Orecchiette tossed with sautéed rapini, garlic, chili and anchovy, finished with crispy muddìche (toasted breadcrumbs) and a hint of lemon zest; a true Barese classic

main_dishes.description: Crisp-roasted chicken braised with white grapes, grappa, pancetta, and rosemary, finished in its own pan jus, served with soft polenta and roasted fennel — rich, comforting, and perfect for a cold night

main_dishes.description: Pan-seared sea bass with a tomato–olive–caper relish, served over lemon-scented farro and finished with fresh herbs; bright, clean flavours inspired by the Adriatic coast
main_dishes.name: Branzino alla Pugliese

Dinner.main_dishes_notes:
The Winterlicious mains are built around everything that makes 7 Numbers what it is — slow cooking, bold flavours, and the kind of Italian comfort food that never goes out of style. Each dish starts with simple ingredients and becomes something special through time, patience, and good olive oil. Featuring local, seasonal produce wherever possible and top-quality meats, fish, and cheeses. Every sauce is made from scratch, every pasta tossed to order, and every plate meant to feel like it came straight from a southern Italian family table.
Guests can expect hearty, generous dishes such as the slow-braised beef ragù with paccheri, handmade orecchiette with rapini and chili, crisp-roasted chicken with grappa and grapes, and pan-seared branzino with lemon-scented farro. All mains are served individually, but prepared with the same spirit brought to their family-style dinners — generous portions, rustic presentation, and no shortcuts. It’s real Italian food, cooked with love, the way Mama Rosa still does it.

description: Café ZUZU is a lively & nostalgic nod to 1950s Italy. Nestled in the heart of Regent Park & inspired by the community, ZUZU merges Janet Zuccarini’s passion for uniquely soulful hospitality with that of giving back & making a difference in the community. The multi-faceted ZUZU is home to a morning café with Italian pastry & time-honoured beverages, co-working spaces, retail selection & bottle shop, and a neighbourhood restaurant where people go to escape the everyday.

description: DaiLo's modern Asian cuisine is predominantly Chinese with French influences using modern techniques with traditional recipes to create unique dishes. At the heart of the menu is a love and respect for the dishes Chef Nick Liu ate growing up as the son of Hakka parents in Canada, but importantly, they are the dishes his ancestors have been eating for hundreds of years. Ancient favourites are augmented by Liu’s signature flair and updated to suit the western palate and the modern demand for local and sustainable ingredients.

description: Coppi Ristorante delivers the quality and consistency of truly authentic Italian food. An intrinsic part of the Lawrence Park community, they have welcomed businesses, family, and friends in Toronto for the more than two decades. Their bold look echoes a fresh infusion of the food, life and style of Italy that they have honoured throughout the years. As always, their aim is to create a gratifying culinary experience for great lovers of food and wine.

description: Located in the heart of the city, The Fox on John is a modern British restaurant & bar serving a diverse menu throughout the day. The signature dishes, beer, spirits, wine, and signature cocktails are complemented by warm and inviting decor. A home away from home in downtown Toronto!

description: Soaring 31 floors high, atop The St. Regis Toronto, LOUIX LOUIS is a mystical spot. Its interior mimics a crystal whiskey glass, reflecting Toronto’s distillery heritage. The dramatic two-story Grand Bar features 500+ dark spirits—one of the largest collections in North America. Local artist Madison van Rijn’s 60-ft mural celebrates Canadian whisky, inviting guests to savour forgotten classics and rediscover the art of conversation.

description: Vinny is where your night starts—and ends. A cool, low-key dining experience begins at 5 PM and a curated DJ soundtrack takes over, setting the rhythm for the rest of the night. Vinny doesn’t try too hard, and doesn’t need to. With moody lighting, warm service, and vinyl spinning in the background, the vibe builds slowly. Effortless. Magnetic. The kind of place you plan to visit for dinner or a drink…and end up staying ‘til last call.

description:
Since 1995, Ruth’s Chris Steak House Downtown Toronto has honoured the same recipe for success that was created by founder, Ruth Fertel and Canadian born, Toronto owner Lana Duke. 
The recipe is simple: Fresh ingredients. Classic dishes. Skilled preparation. Warm hospitality and a passion for every detail to create the perfect night. Recognized worldwide for the finest aged USDA Prime beef available, steaks are broiled to order and served sizzling to stay hot and juicy to the last delicious bite.

description: Although Indian food has a rich and complicated history, the secret to making it is very simple. At The Host, this is a secret learned from their mother, the greatest chef they know and the inspiration for everything they do. In her kitchen, they learned that the best food is always created with love. And love demands that you make no compromises or take shortcuts.

description: Located in the downtown core, Vagabondo Restobar is a lively Italian eatery and bar known for its generous portions, upbeat atmosphere, and stylish, modern décor. Blending classic Italian flavours with a contemporary twist, it offers a wide menu featuring fresh pastas, pizzas, and hearty mains, making it a popular spot for group gatherings, casual dinners, and pre-event meals. Vagabondo Restobar is the go-to destination for both locals and visitors seeking a fun and flavourful dining experience.

description: The Rabbit Hole invites guests to hop on over for elevated pub fare and exceptional cocktails. Rooted in bold British flavours and locally sourced ingredients, the menu features familiar comfort classics alongside cheeky twists on traditional pub dishes—served in a whimsically designed dining room. description: Z Bar & Grille is the quirky little spot on Eglinton West you want to know about when you're in the mood for amazing Caribbean cuisine. All year round, rain or shine, authentic jerk chicken is cooked on a barrel drum, the brisket is slow smoked, the burgers are made in-house and everything is seasoned just right. Since they opened more than 20 years ago, the Z team has gone through 6 barrel drums and cooked more than 650,000 pounds of chicken, pork, and brisket, and still love what they do! You will taste the difference! Craft beers, cocktails and homemade desserts round out the menu.

description: Maxime’s is a refined dining destination in the heart of King West where the allure of Parisian nightlife meets the contemporary elegance of a premier steak and seafood house. Celebrated for its French-inspired reinterpretation of classic steakhouse fare, Maxime’s offers a sensorial experience set against a backdrop of lush, velvety interiors. With nightly DJs and a distinctly cosmopolitan energy, it’s a destination for those who savour the art of dining, designed to delight all the senses.

description: Opened in 2024 in The Well, Lulu Bar Toronto serves up a taste of the Pacific. Lulu’s menu pays tribute to the Pacific Ocean and the many regions that touch it, with influences from Asia to Hawaii, California to British Columbia, resulting in light and fresh fare that is heavy on flavour. The welcoming, airy space is reminiscent of that hidden gem spot from your last vacation.

description: SugarKane is where bold Caribbean flavours meet the soulful kick of Cajun cuisine, creating a dining experience that’s as vibrant as it is unforgettable. Founded by three sisters with roots in Trinidad and Grenada, the restaurant is a tribute their heritage. Step inside and you’re instantly transported into a world of warmth, rhythm, and spice—where the atmosphere buzzes with tropical energy, the cocktails flow with island flair, and the food tells stories of culture, tradition, and celebration

description: Located in Yorkville, Koko Share Bar is a cozy, modern Korean & Japanese restaurant. Koko is known for their signature Dolsot (Hot Stone Bowl) Bibimbap (meaning mixed rice), beautifully and traditionally presented on a hot stone sizzling bowl and enjoyed by Toronto food lovers for more than ten years. Blending authentic Korean and Japanese flavours, the menu also offers Japanese modern rolls, noodles, and grilled items prepared with the freshest ingredients.

description: Beer inspired by a chef and crafted by a brewmaster. Eastbound Brewery is proud of its Riverside roots and can't wait to share what makes their neighbourhood one of the best in the city. From the bar stool-lined brewing operation, to the open concept farm-to-table kitchen, the totally transparent operation showcases classic Tex-Mex pub fare, made with passion, in a contemporary style.

description: Piano Piano is the Italian restaurant you always wished was just around the corner! Sophisticated and fun, Piano Piano serves deeply satisfying food that comes in just the right size. The menu features traditional Italian fare that’s been elevated to its most delicious self. If there’s a common thread that runs through Piano Piano, it’s a deep-seated soulfulness and sensuality that’s at once warm, welcoming, and just plain fun            .

description: Gusto (pronounced Goo-sto) means tasty in Italian. Gusto 101 has been serving up modern takes on Southern Italian classics since 2012. Located in a repurposed garage in the heart of downtown Toronto, the restaurant has become a neighbourhood gathering place. Whether you’re craving the warmth of a wood-fired grill or a glass of wine on the rooftop patio, Gusto will do their best to merge the every day with the exceptional.

description: Set in an array of Victorian row houses, Sassafraz has evolved through the decades to become a magical space in the heart of Yorkville. Located at the corner of Bellair and Cumberland, the little house has 'seen it all' from the early hippie movement of the 60's to the lack of movement that comes from too much Bordeaux. Sassafraz offers an exceptional menu serving market-driven Canadian cuisine.

description: Located in the scenic upper beaches near Kingston Rd and Scarborough Rd, The Porch Light dedicates itself to serving the best comfort food and drink in the area. From small, well-crafted lunch and dinner menus full of locally-sourced produce to a beer list featuring local craft breweries, every aspect is meticulously considered. At night, the lights are dimmed and candles are lit transforming the space into a cozy, stylish dinner spot for foodies and families alike.

description:
Rooted in the farm-to-table philosophy, Joni Restaurant offers a refined culinary experience that celebrates the best of each season, guided by the vision of Executive Chef Jonathan Williams. Honouring the richness of our region, dishes are crafted from locally sourced, sustainable ingredients, featuring the freshest produce, meats, and seafood—all prepared in-house.
Chef Williams’ thoughtfully curated menu evolves with the seasons, delivering exceptional flavour combinations that reflect a deep connection to the land. Each plate is a harmonious blend of simplicity and sophistication, created using contemporary techniques that honour the integrity of every ingredient and draw inspiration from diverse culinary traditions.
The ambience is equally inviting, with warm and attentive service that complements the elevated dining experience.

description: Located on the concourse level, Birroteca has partnered with Indie Alehouse, a pioneer in the Toronto craft beer scene, as their in-house brewery. Birroteca by Indie Alehouse features several beers exclusive to Eataly, rotating flavours inspired by seasonal ingredients, and collaborations with Ontario-based brewers. To pair, Birroteca chefs prepare a variety of Italian dishes to enjoy with a craft beer in hand.

appetizers.description: Paired with crunchy pistachios, refreshing mint, and zesty pickled Anaheim, crafting a delectable medley of textures and flavours in every bite
appetizers.name: Crispy Brussel Sprouts

appetizers.description: A beloved comfort food that combines al dente gemelli with a luxuriously creamy cheese sauce, delivering a harmonious blend of pasta perfection cooked in a charcoal oven to order
appetizers.name: Mac ‘n’ Cheese

Dinner.appetizers_notes:
Begin your Winterlicious experience with an irresistible selection of Chef’s signature starters. Enjoy a rotating variety of freshly prepared appetizers, salads, and side dishes, all made to order and served unlimited throughout your meal.

Please note that the sides listed below represent only a small selection of what is offered in-restaurant to be enjoyed during your dining experience at Copacabana.

desserts.description: A Brazilian favourite—fresh pineapple roasted with cinnamon and sugar until caramelized, offering a warm, sweet, and refreshing finish; a must-have to complete the Rodizio experience
desserts.name: Cinnamon Roasted Pineapple

desserts.description: Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside; sweet bananas panko-crusted, and fried to golden perfection; a classic Brazilian treat
desserts.name: Fried Bananas

desserts.description: Smooth and creamy vanilla bean gelato, offering a cool, refreshing finish to your Brazilian feast
desserts.name: Vanilla Bean Gelato

Dinner.desserts_notes: Finish on a sweet note with a selection of classic, traditional Brazilian desserts

main_dishes.description: Signature Brazilian top sirloin cap, expertly seasoned and grilled over charcoal to achieve a perfect crust and tender, juicy center; carved tableside for an authentic and unforgettable Rodizio experience
main_dishes.name: Picanha

main_dishes.description: Copa's signature creation—prime rib stuffed with cheddar that oozes deliciousness in every cut, delivering a rich, indulgent bite carved fresh tableside
main_dishes.name: Prime Rib with Cheddar

main_dishes.description: Tender, buttery filet mignon crusted with aged Parmesan and grilled to perfection, creating a savoury, melt-in-your-mouth bite with every carving
main_dishes.name: Parmesan Filet Mignon

main_dishes.description: A classic Brazilian favourite—juicy, expertly seasoned top sirloin carved tableside, offering bold, beefy flavour in every tender slice
main_dishes.name: Top Sirloin

main_dishes.description: Salmon grilled over natural charcoal for a smoky, delicate finish; flaky, tender, and beautifully seasoned, carved and served hot for a perfectly refined bite
main_dishes.name: Charcoal-Grilled Salmon

main_dishes.description: Succulent shrimp grilled over natural charcoal, infused with smoky depth and finished with a touch of garlic for a bright, savoury bite
main_dishes.name: Garlic Shrimp

main_dishes.description: Juicy chicken marinated in fresh cilantro and zesty lime, grilled over charcoal for a bright, bold flavour in every tender slice
main_dishes.name: Cilantro Lime Chicken

main_dishes.description: Tender chicken brushed with fiery peri peri sauce, then charcoal-grilled for a smoky, vibrant heat in every juicy bite
main_dishes.name: Peri Peri Chicken

Dinner.main_dishes_notes:
Indulge in the heart of the Copacabana experience with unlimited Rodizio meat service. Throughout your meal, Gaucho chefs carve a continuous rotation of perfectly seasoned and charcoal-grilled meats tableside, offering you a taste of Brazil with every cut.

Your Rodizio experience includes many more cuts and chef’s specialties served throughout the evening beyond what is listed below. Each offering is grilled to perfection over an open flame and served hot from the skewer.

description: A vibrant steakhouse like no other, CopaCabana has been serving the GTA for 20 years, featuring an unlimited, all-inclusive Brazilian Rodizio dinner menu with perfectly grilled steaks and meats carved tableside, and accompanied by an array of fresh, made to order salads, sides, and chef's specialities.

description: The Ace's menu has been meticulously crafted to showcase the best that the Ontario seasons have to offer. Taking a seasonal approach to the menu not only allows the natural environment to dictate what The Ace has on offer, but also presents The Ace team with unique creative opportunities. These opportunities, born from the limitations of the seasons, result in a variety of dishes that highlight beautiful local ingredients sourced from Canadian farmers. Most of The Ace's purveyors are deeply committed to sustainability and grow their products using organic methods.

description: Critically acclaimed to be among Canada’s best restaurants, including a recommendation from Michelin in 2022, Canoe's unique location high atop the TD Bank Tower affords a breathtaking view of the city and Lake Ontario. The design is clean and simple, yet absolutely stylish—a brilliant reflection of this country’s rich raw environment. That same brilliance is captured through the flavours and textures of its inspired regional Canadian cuisine.

description: Located on the Danforth in a building as old as the Rodizio Brazilian tradition, Rodeo offers a truly authentic and unique dining experience. This exciting alternative to the traditional restaurant menu allows you to eat as much as you like for a fixed price! Featuring a variety of salads and appetizers and a great selection of delicious BBQ.

description: Take a trip to the vibrant atmosphere of mid-century Milano without ever leaving Toronto at Trattoria Milano, a new restaurant inspired by Italy’s style capital. description: Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, The Chefs’ House is an innovative concept restaurant run by students from George Brown College's Centre for Hospitality & Culinary Arts. Under the the guidance of a professional instruction team, hospitality and culinary arts students put their skills into practice working in tandem to create, prepare and serve gourmet meals, alongside a wide selection of Canadian and international wines, craft beers, and in-house cocktails.

description: At the corner of Yonge and Wellington, The Joneses offers a playful take on comfort food in a mid-century modern-inspired setting. The menu features premium steaks, standout seafood, fresh pastas, and crave-worthy classics, all complemented by a bold cocktail and wine program. Guests can dine indoors or unwind in the stylish solarium—an inviting covered patio. The Joneses delivers a heaping dose of nostalgia in Toronto’s bustling downtown core.

description:
At Alder’s heart lies its signature wood-fired grill and hearth from which prime meats, fresh seafood and tender vegetables alike are gently transformed by smoke and open flame drawing inspiration from traditions and techniques of the Mediterranean, spanning Spain, France, Italy, Greece and Morocco. 
The dedication of Chef Patrick Kriss and his passionate team, has earned Alder recognition in the Toronto Michelin Guide for 2023, 2024 and 2025.

description: Perched on the 38th floor of The Well, Aera (pronounced “era”) delivers a sky-high dining experience that blends bold flavours with breathtaking views of Toronto’s skyline. In the heart of King West, this refined destination redefines the modern steakhouse, offering everything from expertly prepared prime cuts to premium sushi. Guests are welcomed into a beautifully designed main dining room, where elevated cuisine meets sophisticated style in one of the city’s most striking settings.

description:
Located on the ground floor of 1 Hotel in the heart of downtown, 1 Kitchen Toronto serves up fresh, local, and sustainably sourced farm-to-table cuisine. The restaurant is a zero-waste operation, which spotlights the team’s commitment to preserving the beauty and bounty of nature. 
1 Kitchen is light-filled and open with a glass-walled conservatory-like space, a vaulted wood ceiling and curved trusses hung with greenery.

description: Beso by Patria is where Spain comes out to play—bold, beautiful, and a little bit spicy. description: At Scaddabush, the approach to cooking starts with a very simple rule: anything they can make from scratch, they do. It’s an Italian thing – and frankly, it’s just more delicious that way. When you join them, their mission is to deliver the most fresh, authentic Italian experience, from fresh made pastas to stone baked pizzas and artisanal cocktails. A true Italian indulgent experience at their Kitchen & Bar.

description:
At Bellona, the menu is created using only the finest ingredients with a vegan and vegetarian spin on classic Italian dishes, capturing family nights at Nonna’s! 

Everything is made from scratch in-house -- the pasta, in all its shapes and colours, is made fresh from simple ingredients every morning; the pizza dough undergoes a 24-hour cold fermentation, made from scratch daily. Bellona welcomes you to pick a favourite dish! They promise they won't tell!

description: The Good Son’s menu is a reflection of Toronto's diversity, with a focus on local and seasonal organic produce, hormone free and free range proteins, and most importantly, shared food. The menu is designed so that guests are encouraged to share plates, to create the ultimate social dining experience. The heart of the kitchen is the wood-fired oven – not only used for traditionally made pizza, but for roasting a variety of other menu items.

description: Krystos Modern Greek Cuisine delights guests with Greek dishes that are absolutely loaded with flavour! Guests are warmly greeted and invited to relax in the modern dining room which features an abundance of glass, onyx, and marble, oversized murals, a waterfall and fireplace - a perfect backdrop for a memorable dining experience. The menu of classic Greek fare includes many favourites including fried calamari, and marinated meats like lamb, pork, and free-range, hormone and grain-free chicken.

description: At Cucina di Paisano they aspire to bring a little taste of Italy home with their authentic Italian cuisine. The casual, cozy atmosphere is constantly buzzing with energy, making for an enjoyable, exciting space to meet with friends, family, or associates. Their extensive menu provides a wide range of choices including several vegetarian and gluten-free options, satisfying all tastes and needs.

description: Lee Restaurant, the flagship destination of Susur Lee, invites you on a vibrant culinary journey through Southeast Asia. Chef Lee combines classical French techniques with bold regional spices, creating a symphony of flavours that will delight your palate. The menu celebrates family-style dining, featuring shareable dishes served with an Asian sensibility. The ambiance at Lee is equally captivating. With a warm, mid-century modern design and sleek walnut accents, the restaurant offers an intimate and sophisticated atmosphere.

description: AYLA is a love letter to Hong Kong told through their own unique lens. Food has the power to tell stories and connect people to cultures, places and moments in time. AYLA draws inspiration from their neighborhood and global journeys. Each dish is a snapshot of those stories — fun, unexpected and crafted with respect. It’s food meant to be shared and enjoyed together with friends.

description: Gusto 501 brings an authentic, community-driven culinary experience to Toronto’s east end with a multi-level, open-air dining space, serving rustic Southern Italian fare. Punctuated by a floor-to-ceiling glass façade and reclaimed terracotta accents, this modern space is perfect for a casual dinner or formal event.
